Edited September 28, 2014 by kenbobo

Great idea!

And wow, only 2 hours to make a plugin. Great idea, and it must be very simple to be that quick to make! Now we can recover asteroids so our space center can sell it to potato merchants scientists!

Great idea!

And wow, only 2 hours to make a plugin. Great idea, and it must be very simple to be that quick to make! Now we can recover asteroids so our space center can sell it to potato merchants scientists!

Thanks! You made my day
Thank you so much! This single handedly saved my Space Program.

I presume you have to land it back at KSC for maximum effect?

Is there a differences between the different size asteroids? Surely a class E should be worth more than a class A

I presume you have to land it back at KSC for maximum effect?

Is there a differences between the different size asteroids? Surely a class E should be worth more than a class A

No, I just looked inside the CFG file. It changes part PotatoRoid (all asteroids) so that it pays 100,000 roots.
Awwwww. I was hoping for something that scales. Gives incentive to bring back the big ones
Well, i cannot find a way to give based off of class.

Would basing it off of part mass work? Doesn't give you the class of the potato, exactly, but it does give something to work with.

Edit: Ah, sorry. I see this is only a ModuleManager config now. Clever hack. Pretty sure you'd need a plugin to do what I was thinking.

Edited August 23, 2014 by Cydonian Monk
I won't download until I see screenshots.

D;

another one of the NO PICS NO CLICKS thing?

Grrrrrrr.

D;

another one of the NO PICS NO CLICKS thing?

Grrrrrrr.

We want to know what it is before we download it. You little have little to no information bout the hype powered parts up.
I have removed this mod from Kerbal Stuff after you failed to respond to emails insisting on a more appropriate header image.
Seriously, anyone could post a trojan virus and call it anything.

Even after viewing the mod's Kerbal Stuff page and reading this whole thread I still have zero clue what this mod actually does, besides giving a flat rate of funds for captured asteroids.

When you offer a product/service/etc, even when its free, there is still a certain level of effort people expect you to put into the process of "selling" your product. It isn't unreasonable for people to expect a clear description of how your product works and for you to include a photo or two so people can have a better understanding on how your product works and what it's design looks like. You are expecting people to accept a certain level of risk by downloading something online that could be potentially harmful to their computer. When you put zero effort into the presentation of your mod, you will deter a large number of people from downloading your mod and they probably wont give your mod a second thought from that point on. Cause even if the mod is perfectly safe and virus free, people will think the poor presentation is indicative of the mod's overall quality and functionality.

I'm not trying to be mean and I'm sorry if my comment comes off as rude. I just wanted to kind of explain where people are coming from when they say things like "no pics, no clicks" and what that whole mindset entails. Some people just don't place as much value on presentation, so they have a hard time seeing why it would be worth their time to put a nice presentation together.

I understand i got this wrong

so this is cancelled.
